title: Korean Sticky Chicken Tacos
ingredients: 3/4 lb chicken breast, diced or in strips
instructions: Prep your veggies: shred the red cabbage and carrot, slice the scallion, and separate the romaine lettuce leaves to use as taco shells.
Mix together the gochujang, honey, soy sauce, and rice vinegar in a measuring cup.
Dice the chicken breast into small pieces or thin strips. Put the chicken in a bowl.
Mix in the minced garlic and ginger, plus a dash of gochujang with the chicken.
On medium-high heat, heat a skillet with the sesame oil.
Add the chicken to the skillet and cook until browned and cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the pan. Shred with two forks.
Put the chicken back in the pan and pour the sauce over it. Stir to coat the chicken in the sauce.
Let it simmer for a few minutes until the sauce thickens and becomes sticky.
